queries.sql: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>1. Confirm that <strong>hedge accounting</strong> has been adopted by the client. </p>', '', '', '', '2.18.4 S2-4', '2.18.4 S2-4', '40', 'Active', '2024-03-23 11:31:34')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>2. Confirm the accounting policy choice made by the client in accounting for financial instruments:</p> <ul> <li>The recognition and measurement criteria of IAS 39; or</li> <li>The recognition and measurement criteria of IFRS 9.</li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.18.4 S2-4', '2.18.4 S2-4', '40', 'Active', '2024-03-23 11:31:34')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>3. Obtain details of the hedged item and the hedging instrument. </p> <p><i>A <strong>hedged item</strong> can be a recognised asset or liability, an unrecognised firm commitment, a highly probable forecast transaction or a net investment in a foreign operation, or a component of any such item, provided the item is reliably measurable.</i></p> <p>Only contracts with a party external to the reporting entity (i.e. external to the group or individual entity that is being reported on) can be designated as .<i>hedging instruments</i></p> <p> Most hedging instruments are derivatives measured at fair value through profit or loss. Some written options, as described in paragraph B6.2.4, cannot be hedging instruments. Certain other financial assets/liabilities can be designated as hedging instruments – see IFRS 9.6.2.2</p>', '', '', '', '2.18.4 S2-4', '2.18.4 S2-4', '40', 'Active', '2024-03-23 11:31:34')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>4. Consider whether all of the qualifying criteria have been met in order for hedge accounting to be applied:</p> <ul> <li>The hedging relationship only consists of eligible hedging instruments and eligible hedged items;</li> <li>At inception of the relationship, there is formal designation and documentation of the hedging relationship and the entity’s risk management objective and strategy for undertaking the hedge (see test below); </li> <li>There is an economic relationship between the hedged item and the hedging instrument;</li> <li>The effect of credit risk does not dominate the value changes that result from that economic relationship; and</li> <li>The hedge ratio of the hedging relationship is the same as that resulting from the quantity of the hedged item that the entity actually hedges and the quantity of the hedging instrument that the entity actually uses to hedge that quantity of hedged item.</li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.18.4 S2-4', '2.18.4 S2-4', '40', 'Active', '2024-03-23 11:31:34')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>5. Obtain the documentation of the hedging relationship and consider whether the following have been clearly identified: </p> <ul> <li>The hedging instrument;</li> <li>The hedged item;</li> <li>The nature of the risk being hedged; and</li> <li>How the entity will assess whether the hedging relationship meets the effectiveness requirements, including sources of hedge ineffectiveness.</li> </ul> <p><i>An economic relationship between a hedged item and hedging instrument exists when the entity expects that the values of the hedged item and hedging instrument will typically move in opposite directions in response to movements in the same risk, which is the hedged risk.</i></p>', '', '', '', '2.18.4 S2-4', '2.18.4 S2-4', '40', 'Active', '2024-03-23 11:31:34')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>6. Confirm the type of hedging relationship in place. This will be one of the 3 following categories:</p> <ul> <li>Fair Value hedge;</li> <li>Cash Flow hedge</li> <li>Hedge of a net investment in a foreign operation.</li> </ul> <p><i>A <strong>Fair Value hedge</strong> is a hedge of the exposure to changes in fair value of a recognised asset or liability or an unrecognised firm commitment, or a component of any such item, that is attributable to a particular risk and could affect profit or loss. For example – a contract to purchase stock from an overseas supplier, hedged by a compensating forward exchange contract.</i></p> <p><i>A <strong>Cash Flow hedge</strong> is a hedge of the exposure to variability in cash flows that is attributable to a particular risk associated with all, or a component of, a recognised asset or liability (such as all or some future interest payments on variable rate debt) or a highly probable forecast transaction, and could affect profit or loss. For example, an interest rate swap.</i></p> <p><i>A hedge of the foreign currency risk of an unrecognised firm commitment may be accounted for as a fair value hedge or as a cash flow hedge.</i></p>', '', '', '', '2.18.4 S2-4', '2.18.4 S2-4', '40', 'Active', '2024-03-23 11:31:34')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>Fair Value Hedges</h6>\r\n<p>7. Ensure the gain/loss on the hedging instrument has been recognised in profit or loss.</p>\r\n<p><i>If the hedging instrument hedges an equity instrument for which an entity has elected to present changes in fair value in other comprehensive income, the gain/loss should be recognised in OCI.</i></p>', '', '', '', '2.18.4 S2-4', '2.18.4 S2-4', '40', 'Active', '2024-03-23 11:31:34')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>8. The hedging gain/loss on the hedged item should also be recognised in profit or loss, with the carrying value of the hedged item adjusted accordingly. Ensure this is the case.</p> <p><i>If the hedged item is an equity instrument for which an entity has elected to present changes in fair value in other comprehensive income, the hedging gain/loss should remain in OCI.</i></p> <p><i>If the hedged item is an unrecognised firm commitment, the cumulative hedging gain/loss on the hedged item is recognised as a separate asset/liability, with a corresponding entry through profit or loss.</i></p> ', '', '', '', '2.18.4 S2-4', '2.18.4 S2-4', '40', 'Active', '2024-03-23 11:31:34')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>9. If the hedged item is a financial instrument recognised at amortised cost, then any adjustment arising under test 9 above shall be amortised to profit or loss.</p>', '', '', '', '2.18.4 S2-4', '2.18.4 S2-4', '40', 'Active', '2024-03-23 11:31:34')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>10. If the hedged item is an unrecognised firm commitment to purchase an asset or assume a liability, has the initial carrying amount of the asset/liability that arises as a result of meeting the commitment been adjusted to include the cumulative hedging gain/loss of the hedged item that had been recognised in the statement of financial position?</p>\r\n<p><i>For example: the hedged item is a commitment to purchase a fixed asset from an overseas supplier, and the hedging instrument is a compensating forward exchange contract. The cumulative gain or loss on recognising the fair value of the purchase commitment is CU100. The asset, when acquired, costs CU500. The carrying value is consequently adjusted to be CU400.</i></p>\r\n', '', '', '', '2.18.4 S2-4', '2.18.4 S2-4', '40', 'Active', '2024-03-23 11:31:34')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>Cash Flow Hedge</h6> <p>11. A <strong>Cash Flow Hedge</strong> Reserve should be recognised in equity (as a separate reserve), being the lower of, IN ABSOLUTE TERMS (i.e. ignoring positives or negatives):</p> <ul> <li>The cumulative gain/loss on the hedging instrument; and</li> <li>The cumulative change in fair value on the hedged item</li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.18.4 S2-4', '2.18.4 S2-4', '40', 'Active', '2024-03-23 11:31:34')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>12. Has the portion of the gain/loss on the hedging instrument that is an <strong>effective hedge</strong> been recognised through <strong>other comprehensive income</strong>?</p>\r\n<p><i>This is the portion of the gain/loss that is offset by the change in the cash flow hedge reserve. </i></p>', '', '', '', '2.18.4 S2-4', '2.18.4 S2-4', '40', 'Active', '2024-03-23 11:31:34')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>13. Ensure that any gain/loss that relates to <strong>hedge ineffectiveness</strong> has passed through profit or loss.</p>\r\n<p><i>This is any gain/loss required to balance the change in the cash flow hedge reserve.</i></p>', '', '', '', '2.18.4 S2-4', '2.18.4 S2-4', '40', 'Active', '2024-03-23 11:31:34')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>14. Ensure that the cash flow hedge reserve has been appropriately treated: </p> <ul> <li>If the transaction results in the recognition of a non-financial asset or liability, the related amount should be removed from the cash flow hedge reserve and included directly in the initial carrying value of that non-financial asset or liability;</li> <li>If not, the cash flow hedge reserve should be reclassified to profit or loss in the same period or periods during which the hedged expected future cash flows affect profit or loss;</li> <li>If the amount is a loss, and all or part of that loss is not expected to be recovered, the amount of the loss not expected to be recovered shall be reclassified to profit or loss immediately.</li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.18.4 S2-4', '2.18.4 S2-4', '40', 'Active', '2024-03-23 11:31:34')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>Net Investment in Foreign Operations</h6> <p>15. This type of hedge is normally only relevant when consolidated accounts have been prepared, and are accounted for in a similar manner to cash flow hedges. Ensure that:</p> <ul> <li>The portion of the gain or loss on the hedging instrument that is determined to be an effective hedge is recognised in other comprehensive income; and</li> <li>The ineffective portion is recognised in profit or loss.</li> </ul> <p><i>Please note that the cumulative gain or loss on the hedging instrument relating to the effective portion of the hedge that has been accumulated in equity shall not be reclassified from equity to profit or loss on disposal or partial disposal of the foreign operation.</i></p>', '', '', '', '2.18.4 S2-4', '2.18.4 S2-4', '40', 'Active', '2024-03-23 11:31:34')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>16. If hedge accounting has been discontinued, ensure that this has occurred for one of the following reasons:</p> <ul> <li>The hedging instrument has expired, is sold, terminated or exercised; or</li> <li>The conditions for hedge accounting are no longer met; or</li> <li>The entity has elected to discontinue hedge accounting and the entity has documented this decision. </li> </ul> <p><i>In all cases, hedge accounting shall be discontinued prospectively (i.e. not as a prior year adjustment).</i></p>', '', '', '', '2.18.4 S2-4', '2.18.4 S2-4', '40', 'Active', '2024-03-23 11:31:34')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>17. The only significant impact of discontinuing hedge accounting arises where there was a cash flow hedge. </p> <ul> <li> If the hedged future cash flows are no longer expected to occur, ensure that the amount that has been accumulated in the cash flow hedge reserve was reclassified to profit or loss immediately; and</li> <li> If the hedged future cash flows are still expected to occur (for example when the entity has voluntarily elected to discontinue hedge accounting), the cumulative gain or loss in the cash flow hedge reserve should be retained in that reserve until the future cash flows occur (as per test 15 above).</li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.18.4 S2-4', '2.18.4 S2-4', '40', 'Active', '2024-03-23 11:31:34')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>18. Review the detailed transition requirements set out in Chapter 7 of IFRS 9 and ensure these have been appropriately applied.</p>', '', '', '', '2.18.4 S2-4', '2.18.4 S2-4', '40', 'Active', '2024-03-23 11:31:34')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>19. Obtain a reconciliation that shows the impact of first-time adoption of IFRS 9. This should include:</p> <ul> <li>Narrative explanation of how the first-time adoption has been treated;</li> <li>Narrative explanation of the changes made on first time adoption;</li> <li>Narrative relating to any reclassifications made;</li> <li> <p>An analysis of each line item in the financial statements as at the end of the prior reporting period (e.g 31 December 2017 for a 31 December 2018 year end) affected by the change, showing:</p> <ul> <li>The figure as originally stated under IAS 39;</li> <li>Any reclassification adjustments made (e.g. showing contract assets separately);</li> <li>Any remeasurement changes from applying the IFRS 9 requirements;</li> <li>The restated figure under IFRS 9</li> <li>This should also include a reconciliation of retained earnings as at the date of initial application. </li> </ul> </li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.18.4 S2-4', '2.18.4 S2-4', '40', 'Active', '2024-03-23 11:31:34')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>20. If the hedge accounting transition results in a retrospective amendment, ensure that this has been treated appropriately (per IFRS 9.7.2.26). </p>', '', '', '', '2.18.4 S2-4', '2.18.4 S2-4', '40', 'Active', '2024-03-23 11:31:34')

Array
(
    [0] => <p>1.	Confirm that <strong>hedge accounting</strong> has been adopted by the client. </p>
    [1] => <p>2.	Confirm the accounting policy choice made by the client in accounting for financial instruments:</p>
<ul>
    <li>The recognition and measurement criteria of IAS 39; or</li>
    <li>The recognition and measurement criteria of IFRS 9.</li>
</ul>
    [2] => <p>3.	Obtain details of the hedged item and the hedging instrument. </p>
<p><i>A  <strong>hedged item</strong> can be a recognised asset or liability, an unrecognised firm commitment, a highly probable forecast transaction or a net investment in a foreign operation, or a component of any such item, provided the item is reliably measurable.</i></p>
<p>Only contracts with a party external to the reporting entity (i.e. external to the group or individual entity that is being reported on) can be designated as .<i>hedging instruments</i></p>
<p> Most hedging instruments are derivatives measured at fair value through profit or loss.  Some written options, as described in paragraph B6.2.4, cannot be hedging instruments. Certain other financial assets/liabilities can be designated as hedging instruments – see IFRS 9.6.2.2</p>
    [3] => <p>4.	Consider whether all of the qualifying criteria have been met in order for hedge accounting to be applied:</p>
<ul>
    <li>The hedging relationship only consists of eligible hedging instruments and eligible hedged items;</li>
    <li>At inception of the relationship, there is formal designation and documentation of the hedging relationship and the entity’s risk management objective and strategy for undertaking the hedge (see test below); </li>
    <li>There is an economic relationship between the hedged item and the hedging instrument;</li>
    <li>The effect of credit risk does not dominate the value changes that result from that economic relationship; and</li>
    <li>The hedge ratio of the hedging relationship is the same as that resulting from the quantity of the hedged item that the entity actually hedges and the quantity of the hedging instrument that the entity actually uses to hedge that quantity of hedged item.</li>
</ul>
    [4] => <p>5.	Obtain the documentation of the hedging relationship and consider whether the following have been clearly identified: </p>
<ul>
    <li>The hedging instrument;</li>
    <li>The hedged item;</li>
    <li>The nature of the risk being hedged; and</li>
    <li>How the entity will assess whether the hedging relationship meets the effectiveness requirements, including sources of hedge ineffectiveness.</li>
</ul>
<p><i>An economic relationship between a hedged item and hedging instrument exists when the entity expects that the values of the hedged item and hedging instrument will typically move in opposite directions in response to movements in the same risk, which is the hedged risk.</i></p>
    [5] => <p>6.	Confirm the type of hedging relationship in place. This will be one of the 3 following categories:</p>
<ul>
    <li>Fair Value hedge;</li>
    <li>Cash Flow hedge</li>
    <li>Hedge of a net investment in a foreign operation.</li>
</ul>
<p><i>A <strong>Fair Value hedge</strong> is a hedge of the exposure to changes in fair value of a recognised asset or liability or an unrecognised firm commitment, or a component of any such item, that is attributable to a particular risk and could affect profit or loss.  For example – a contract to purchase stock from an overseas supplier, hedged by a compensating forward exchange contract.</i></p>
<p><i>A <strong>Cash Flow hedge</strong> is a hedge of the exposure to variability in cash flows that is attributable to a particular risk associated with all, or a component of, a recognised asset or liability (such as all or some future interest payments on variable rate debt) or a highly probable forecast transaction, and could affect profit or loss. For example, an interest rate swap.</i></p>
<p><i>A hedge of the foreign currency risk of an unrecognised firm commitment may be accounted for as a fair value hedge or as a cash flow hedge.</i></p>
    [6] => <h6>Fair Value Hedges</h6>
<p>7.	Ensure the gain/loss on the hedging instrument has been recognised in profit or loss.</p>
<p><i>If the hedging instrument hedges an equity instrument for which an entity has elected to present changes in fair value in other comprehensive income, the gain/loss should be recognised in OCI.</i></p>
    [7] => <p>8.	The hedging gain/loss on the hedged item should also be recognised in profit or loss, with the carrying value of the hedged item adjusted accordingly. Ensure this is the case.</p>
<p><i>If the hedged item is an equity instrument for which an entity has elected to present changes in fair value in other comprehensive income, the hedging gain/loss should remain in OCI.</i></p>
<p><i>If the hedged item is an unrecognised firm commitment, the cumulative hedging gain/loss on the hedged item is recognised as a separate asset/liability, with a corresponding entry through profit or loss.</i></p>

    [8] => <p>9.	If the hedged item is a financial instrument recognised at amortised cost, then any adjustment arising under test 9 above shall be amortised to profit or loss.</p>
    [9] => <p>10.	If the hedged item is an unrecognised firm commitment to purchase an asset or assume a liability, has the initial carrying amount of the asset/liability that arises as a result of meeting the commitment been adjusted to include the cumulative hedging gain/loss of the hedged item that had been recognised in the statement of financial position?</p>
<p><i>For example: the hedged item is a commitment to purchase a fixed asset from an overseas supplier, and the hedging instrument is a compensating forward exchange contract. The cumulative gain or loss on recognising the fair value of the purchase commitment is CU100. The asset, when acquired, costs CU500. The carrying value is consequently adjusted to be CU400.</i></p>

    [10] => <h6>Cash Flow Hedge</h6>
<p>11.	A <strong>Cash Flow Hedge</strong> Reserve should be recognised in equity (as a separate reserve), being the lower of, IN ABSOLUTE TERMS (i.e. ignoring positives or negatives):</p>
<ul>
    <li>The cumulative gain/loss on the hedging instrument; and</li>
    <li>The cumulative change in fair value on the hedged item</li>
</ul>
    [11] => <p>12.	Has the portion of the gain/loss on the hedging instrument that is an <strong>effective hedge</strong> been recognised through <strong>other comprehensive income</strong>?</p>
<p><i>This is the portion of the gain/loss that is offset by the change in the cash flow hedge reserve. </i></p>
    [12] => <p>13.	Ensure that any gain/loss that relates to <strong>hedge ineffectiveness</strong> has passed through profit or loss.</p>
<p><i>This is any gain/loss required to balance the change in the cash flow hedge reserve.</i></p>
    [13] => <p>14.	Ensure that the cash flow hedge reserve has been appropriately treated: </p>
<ul>
    <li>If the transaction results in the recognition of a non-financial asset or liability, the related amount should be removed from the cash flow hedge reserve and included directly in the initial carrying value of that non-financial asset or liability;</li>
    <li>If not, the cash flow hedge reserve should be reclassified  to profit or loss in the same period or periods during which the hedged expected future cash flows affect profit or loss;</li>
    <li>If the amount is a loss, and all or part of that loss is not expected to be recovered, the amount of the loss not expected to be recovered shall be reclassified to profit or loss immediately.</li>
</ul>
    [14] => <h6>Net Investment in Foreign Operations</h6>
<p>15.	This type of hedge is normally only relevant when consolidated accounts have been prepared, and are accounted for in a similar manner to cash flow hedges. Ensure that:</p>
<ul>
    <li>The portion of the gain or loss on the hedging instrument that is determined to be an effective hedge is recognised in other comprehensive income; and</li>
    <li>The ineffective portion is recognised in profit or loss.</li>
</ul>
<p><i>Please note that the cumulative gain or loss on the hedging instrument relating to the effective portion of the hedge that has been accumulated in equity shall not be reclassified from equity to profit or loss on disposal or partial disposal of the foreign operation.</i></p>
    [15] => <p>16.	If hedge accounting has been discontinued, ensure that this has occurred for one of the following reasons:</p>
<ul>
    <li>The hedging instrument has expired, is sold, terminated or exercised; or</li>
    <li>The conditions for hedge accounting are no longer met; or</li>
    <li>The entity has elected to discontinue hedge accounting and the entity has documented this decision. </li>
</ul>
<p><i>In all cases, hedge accounting shall be discontinued prospectively (i.e. not as a prior year adjustment).</i></p>
    [16] => <p>17.	The only significant impact of discontinuing hedge accounting arises where there was a cash flow hedge. </p>
<ul>
    <li>	If the hedged future cash flows are no longer expected to occur, ensure that the amount that has been accumulated in the cash flow hedge reserve was reclassified to profit or loss immediately; and</li>
    <li>	If the hedged future cash flows are still expected to occur (for example when the entity has voluntarily elected to discontinue hedge accounting), the cumulative gain or loss in the cash flow hedge reserve should be retained in that reserve until the future cash flows occur (as per test 15 above).</li>
</ul>
    [17] => <p>18.	Review the detailed transition requirements set out in Chapter 7 of IFRS 9 and ensure these have been appropriately applied.</p>
    [18] => <p>19.	Obtain a reconciliation that shows the impact of first-time adoption of IFRS 9. This should include:</p>
<ul>
    <li>Narrative explanation of how the first-time adoption has been treated;</li>
    <li>Narrative explanation of the changes made on first time adoption;</li>
    <li>Narrative relating to any reclassifications made;</li>
    <li>
        <p>An analysis of each line item in the financial statements as at the end of the prior reporting period (e.g 31 December 2017 for a 31 December 2018 year end) affected by the change, showing:</p>
        <ul>
            <li>The figure as originally stated under IAS 39;</li>
            <li>Any reclassification adjustments made (e.g. showing contract assets separately);</li>
            <li>Any remeasurement changes from applying the IFRS 9 requirements;</li>
            <li>The restated figure under IFRS 9</li>
            <li>This should also include a reconciliation of retained earnings as at the date of initial application. </li>
        </ul>
    </li>
</ul>
    [19] => <p>20.	If the hedge accounting transition results in a retrospective amendment, ensure that this has been treated appropriately (per IFRS 9.7.2.26). </p>
)
